member.name: M:Common.Patterns.Threading.LockFree.InitializeField``1(``0@,System.Func{``0},System.Func{``0,``0},``0)
member.summary: Used to instantiate and initialize an object and set that object to a field in a lock-free manner only if the field's value is equal to the unInitializeValue.
member.typeparam: The object being created and intialized
member.param: The field that will be examimed to determine if it will be assinged (updated)
The value used to determine if the field will be assigned. If the values are reference equal, the creation function is called. If not the field's value is returned. The default is null.

The function used to create an instance of T, assign this value to the field, and then call the initialization function (if one is defined). Note: If this function returns the unInitializeValue the initialization function is NOT called and this value is returned.
Warning; This function can be called from multpile threads (only once on a thread) but only one value will be assigned to the field.

The function (optional) that is called to complete the initialization of the field's value. This function is only called once but the field's value is NOT locked and can be changed/accessed from other threads!
Note: The returned value from this function will NOT be used to set the field but is the value returned by InitializeField.
member.returns: The newly created instance from the creation function, the returned instance from the initialization function, or the original value of the field in the case where the unInitializedValue are not RefernceEqual.
member.remarks:
Since locks are not used, the creation function can be called multiple times from different threads but only one value will be assigned to the field. The initialization function will only be called once but the field's value is NOT locked and can be changed/accessed from other threads!
ReferenceEquals is used as the comparison operator to determine if the field has been updated by the creation function.

member.summary: Updates the field in a LockFree manner using the SpinWait-Interlocked.CompareExchange pattern.
member.typeparam: The type of Object being updated (must be a class)
member.param: the Field being updated

A user defined function that must return a value of "T" that is used to update the field. member.returns: The updated value

Once the proceedConditionFlag is in the unsetValue and before execution, this function will set the proceedConditionFlag to the setValue and once execution is completed the proceedConditionFlag is reset to the unsetValue (all as an atomic operation).

A thread object that is actually a WaitHandle so that WaitOne, WaitAny, etc will perform similar actions but with threads.
